revised_title: Anharmonic Vibration and Forbidden Reflexions in Silicon and Germanium: A Study of High-Temperature Neutron Diffraction
tldr: This article investigates the anharmonic vibrations in silicon and germanium, which can be observed through neutron diffraction at high temperatures. The authors found that significant anharmonic vibrations generate the "forbidden" reflexions, which are not present in the harmonic version of the structure factor. The study provides a basis for understanding the behavior of these materials under high-temperature conditions and helps in detecting anharmonic phenomena in Bragg scattering.
